questions.uddipok: The pie chart shows the passing rates of different subjects of a school. Now, write a paragraph analyzing/describing the chart and give a suitable title to it.

sub_questions.explanation:
Passing rates in different subjects
The given pie chart shows the passing rates of the students of a school in different subjects. The subjects mentioned in the chart are English, Bangla, Science and Mathematics.
As per the version of the chart, 85 % 85 \% 85% of the students have passed in English, 74.8 % 74.8 \% 74.8% of them in Science, 88 % 88 \% 88% of the students have passed in Mathematics and 89.8 % 89.8 \% 89.8% of the students have passed in Bangla. From the chart, it is evident (স্পষ্ট) that the highest number of studerits has passed in Bangla, while the lowest number of students has passed in Science.
The chart gives us a clear picture of the performance of the students of the school. Students' performance in Bangla, Mathematics and English are undoubtedly encouraging, but their performance in Science is not satisfactory. Only 74.8 % 74.8 \% 74.8% students passed in Science. Overall, to sum up the pie chart an arrangement of special coaching classes on Science can be made for the students of this school.

questions.uddipok: The following is the beginning of a story. Complete it in your own words: In one fine morning, Amit started to think about his struggles, pain and hardships he went through for the last couple of years. It was not at all an enjoyable journey of 3 years with this 59 souls whom professionally everyone would regard as Amit's batch mates. But he knows………..

sub_questions.explanation: Amit and His Missed Journey In one fine morning, Amit started to think about his struggles, pain and hardships he went through for the last couple of years. It was not at all an enjoyable journey of 3 years with this 59 souls whom professionally everyone would regard as Amit's batch mates. But he knows they had hardly ever interacted like the others to be called batch mates; they know nothing about each other but the names. Although it is not Amit's fault, he cannot but feel guilty for the change of course in their lives. When the first announcement of the Covid lockdown came 3 years ago, Amit had just moved in abroad to complete his higher studies. Like everyone else, many of his plans completely shattered. He was a stranger locked in a strange room in some foreign country miles away from home. The mountains he wanted to climb and the lakes he wanted to swim in, they were right outside his window but he could do nothing about it. Except on the morning when he started thinking about his struggles of 3 years, the lockdown had already lifted. So, he picked up a bag, folded in some clothes and started on a journey he had missed in the past.

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Masrafee. Recently, you came to know that your younger brother Shahin has started making TikTok videos professionally ignoring all his studies. Now, write a letter to your brother informing him the importance of studies in life and the negative sides of TikTok.

sub_questions.explanation:
12 Quazi Nazrul Islam Avenue,
Shahbagh, Dhaka
23 March 2024
Dear Shahin,
I hope you're doing well. I came to know from our father that you are neglecting your studies. More importantly, you are addicted to TikTok activities. Well, I'm very shocked to know these facts about you. Do you know how important it is to study? Studying hard helps us learn new things and become smart. It's like a superpower that helps us do great things in life! It's also important to make good results for your brighter future. On the other hand, Tiktok is an addiction. It can be fun, but it has many harmful sides. Sometimes, it makes us waste a lot of time, and we forget to do our homework or study. Also, some things on TikTok might not be good for us to see. So, let's make sure we focus on our studies and be careful with TikTok. That way, we can grow up to be really smart and successful!
With love, Masrafee

questions.uddipok:
Write a summary of the following passage.
Education aims to bring about positive changes in our behavior. It helps us try to change our lives as well as the society we live in. Education that does not illuminate our minds or does not inspire us to work for the community is not complete at all. Education is not all about getting grades or receiving certificates- we use education to make life better. We are expected to apply the knowledge, skills and values that we learn in a classroom in our engagement with the world that lies outside. And we can do so in many different ways. Let's have a look at how education works. Learners' civic engagement is highly appreciated all over the world. Civic engagement means working to make a difference in the civic life (the public life of the citizens as constructed with private or personal life) of the community using knowledge, skills, values and motivation. Civic engagement promotes the quality of life in a community by contributing to the improvement of health and wellbeing of the people.
Civically engaged individuals recognize themselves as members of a larger social community and are concerned about civic issues. They consider themselves responsible citizens who take action or raise their voices against injustice, discrimination and other forms of social ills.
In civic engagement, issues of public concern are crucial. Civic engagement includes individual or group activities to protect public interests and change the way the community values itself. For example, If you are protesting against any unjust decision of the local municipality such as raising taxes or an act that might work against people's interests, you are civically engaged and your action is considered a civic engagement. This protest can be done in different ways such as organizing rallies, collecting signatures, making human chains, writing petitions, etc. You can also help control traffic in front of a school, help children to cross the roads, work in a team to clean a park or a sea beach. You can also give some services to elderly people. These are all examples of civic engagement as what you do directly affects the community.
When civic engagement is a part of an academic program, and the learners' engagement is assessed following a scale, then it is called service learning. It involves the application of knowledge and skills learned in the classroom and then making a complete plan of action 1.e. preparing a budget, starting the process of implementation, involving people and activating operational strategies.

sub_questions.explanation: Education plays a vital role in bringing about positive changes in behaviour. It helps us try to change our life as well as our society. Complete education not only illuminates our minds but also inspires us to work for the community. The purpose of education is not getting grades and receiving certificates. The main objective of education is to make life better. Civic engagement of the learners is highly appreciated all over the world nowadays. A civically engaged person works to create a difference in the civic life taking action or raising voice against injustice, discrimination and other forms of social ills. When we work for social welfare, we are civically engaged. Civic engagement may be individual or group activities. For example, we can raise voice against raising excessive taxes. This protest can be done by organising ralles, collecting signature, making human chains, etc. Learners engagement is evaluated by following a scale. questions.uddipok:
Summarize the following text.
Valentina Tereshkova was born in a village, in Central Russia on 6 March 1937. Her father was a tractor driver and her mother worked in a textile plant. At the age of eight she began her schooling but did not enjoy it much. She left the school within a few years. Afterwards she completed her education through distance learning. She became interested in parachuting from a young age, and trained in skydiving at the local Aeroclub, making her first jump at age 22 on 21 May 1959. It was her expertise in skydiving that led to her selection as a cosmonaut.After the flight of Yuri Gagarin, the first human being to travel to outer space in April 1961, the Soviet Union decided to send a woman in space. On 16 February 1962, "proletaria" Valentina Tereshkova was selected for this project from among more than four hundred applicants. Tereshkova had to undergo a series of training that included weightless flights, isolation tests, centrifuge tests, rocket theory, spacecraft engineering, 120 parachute jumps and pilot training in MiG-15UTI jet fighters. Since the successful launch of the spacecraft Vostok-5 on 14 June 1963, Tereshkova began preparing for her own flight. On the morning of 16 June 1963, Tereshkova and her. back-up cosmonaut Solovyova were dressed in space-suits and taken to the space shuttle launch pad by a bus. After completing her communication and life support checks, she was sealed inside Vostok-6. Finishing a two-
hour countdown, Vostok-6 launched faultlessly. Although Tereshkova experienced nausea and physical discomfort for much of the flight, she orbited the earth 48 times and spent almost three days in space. With a single flight, she logged more flight time than the combined times of all American astronauts who had flown before that date. Tereshkova also maintained a flight log and took photographs of the horizon, which were later used to identify aerosol layers within the atmosphere. Vostok-6 was the final Vostok flight and was launched two days after Vostok-5, which carried Valary Bykovsky into a similar orbit for five days, landing three hours after Tereshkova. The two vessels approached each other within 5 kilometers at one point, and from space Tereshkova communicated with Bykovsky and the Soviet leader Khrushchev by radio.

sub_questions.explanation: Valentina Tereshkova, born in 1937, grew up in Central Russia. She left school early but continued education through distance learning. Passionate about parachuting, she trained extensively and made her first jump at 22. Selected as a cosmonaut in 1962, she underwent rigorous training. On June 16, 1963, she boarded Vostok-6, becoming the first woman in space. Despite feeling discomfort, she orbited Earth 48 times in nearly three days, contributing valuable data. Her flight time surpassed combined American astronaut times. Tereshkova's achievements marked a significant milestone in space exploration.

questions.uddipok:
The following sentences are jumbled. Rearrange them in proper sequence.
1×10=10
(a) He grew up in a lower-middle-class family and showed an early interest in art.
(b) In 1933, Hitler was appointed Chancellor of Germany, and then Germany became a dictatorship.
(c) Following his release from prison, Hitler focused on rebuilding the Nazi Party and promoting his nationalist and anti-Semitic ideology.
(d) Following Germany's defeat in 1945, Hitler committed suicide in his bunker in Berlin on April 30, bringing
an end to one of the darkest chapters in human history.
(e) After the death of his father, Hitler moved to Vienna to pursue a career as an artist but was rejected by the Vienna Academy of Fine Arts.
(f) Under his leadership, the Nazi regime implemented policies that led to the persecution and murder of millions, including Jews, Roma, disabled individuals, and political opponents.
(g) He later moved to Munich, where he became increasingly involved in politics.
(h) Hitler's aggressive expansionist policies ultimately led to World War II.
(i) Adolf Hitler was born on April 20, 1889, in Brunau am Inn, Austria-Hungary (now Austria).
(j) In 1923, he attempted to seize power in the failed Beer Hall Putsch.

sub_questions.explanation:
(i)→(a)→(e)→(g) → (j)→(c)→(b)→(f)→ (h) → (d).
Adolf Hitler was born on April 20, 1889, in Braunau am Inn, Austria-Hungary (now Austria). He grew up in a lower-middle-class family and showed an early interest in art. After the death of his father, Hitler moved to Vienna to pursue a career as an artist but was rejected by the Vienna Academy of Fine Arts. He later moved to Munich, where he became increasingly involved in politics. In 1923, he attempted to seize power in the failed Beer Hall Putsch. Following his release from prison, Hitler focused on rebuilding the Nazi Party and promoting his nationalist and anti-Semitic ideology. In 1933, Hitler was appointed Chancellor of Germany, and then Germany became a dictatorship. Under his leadership, the Nazi regime implemented policies that led to the persecution and murder of millions, including Jews, Roma, disabled individuals, and political opponents. Hitler's aggressive expansionist policies ultimately led to World War II. Following Germany's defeat in 1945, Hitler committed suicide in his bunker in Berlin on April 30, bringing an end to one of the darkest chapters in human history.
